author: Mike Taylor
title: Metro Detroit Weather: A breezy warm up today
text: Steady showers and a few thunderstorms roll through Sunday evening. The chance for storms ends overnight, but showers will continue through the early morning. Lows fall into the low 40s by Monday morning. Scattered light showers continue Monday, with otherwise partly sunny skies. Winds will be out of the north at 10 mph, with a few gusts up to 20 mph. Temperatures drop Monday night into Tuesday morning into the 30s. Frost will be likely, outside the immediate Metro Detroit region. Partly sunny skies continue Tuesday, with a chance for showers up near Lake Huron. Temperatures climb to near 50Â°, with 51Â° expected in Detroit. High pressure will bring sunshine Wednesday through Saturday with temperatures slowly warming each day. Lows will be in the 30s Wednesday, with highs in the low 50s. Lows start back in the 30s Thursday, but highs climb to near 60Â°. Lows start again in the 30s Friday, but highs climb into the low to mid 60s. Finally on Saturday temperatures start in the low 40s and climb into the upper 60s. Tonight: Rain moves through with a chance of thunder. Lows in the low 40s. Winds: N 10 G20 mph. Monday: Partly sunny with a scattered showers. Highs in the low to mid 50s. Winds: N 10 G20 mph. Tuesday: Partly sunny. Chance for a shower near Lake Huron. Highs near 50Â°. Winds: NW 5-15 mph. [Detroit weather 7-day forecast](https://www.wxyz.com/weather/daily-forecast) Connect with 7 First Alert Meteorologists: Facebook: [Dave Rexroth](https://www.facebook.com/home.php#!/daverexroth) , [Hally Vogel](https://www.facebook.com/Meteorologist-Hally-Vogel-WXYZ-296975016981225/), Mike Taylor, [Marisa Woloszyn](http://www.facebook.com/MarisaWoloszyn) X: [Dave Rexroth](https://twitter.com/rexroth7wxyz) , [Hally Vogel](https://twitter.com/HallyVogelWXYZ), Mike Taylor, [Marisa Woloszyn](http://www.twitter.com/Marisa%20Woloszyn)

author: Anthony Walsh
title: Alannah Yipâ€™s Top 4 Tips for Sport Projecting
text:
Alannah Yip is one of Canadaâ€™s most decorated climbersâ€”indoors or out. Not only was she the sole female to represent Canada at the Tokyo Olympics, sheâ€™s also sent Pulse (5.14a) and Room Service (V12) in Squamish, B.C. I recently interviewed Yip at the Arcâ€™teryx Climbing Academy, where we talked about her illustrious (and recently finished) comp career, her hair loss due to Alopecia, mental training, and her transition to full-time rock climbing. You can read our conversation here.
Alannah Yip shares the final points of clipping while horrifically pumped during a sport-climbing tactics clinic at the Arcâ€™teryx Climbing Academy in Squamish, B.C. (Photo: Anthony Walsh) The next day, Yip gave a sport climbing clinic which I eagerly attended. She dropped a lot of knowledge beneath Squamishâ€™s famous granite crags, but four things stuck out to me for projecting sport routes at your limit:
On figuring out impossible moves : Stick clip up and ask for a take so you can get weight off your arms, and feel all the available holds and test all possible body positions. Consider working down from key holds or rests, rather than solely working up. Warm up : Itâ€™s not just about injury prevention. Yip canâ€™t climb her hardest without a proper, full-body warm up including shoulders, fingers, and hips. She does 10-15 minutes of ground warm up before doing her first pitch. On that first warm-up pitch, the goal is to warm upâ€”not send! Yip has taken on 5.9 before if she get confused. She stresses: Do not get pumped on the warm up. If sheâ€™s doing a 5.14a project, for example, sheâ€™d warm up on an 5.11+ and then a 5.12+/13-, and then do finger-specific warm up on a hangboard. Be efficient when resting : Itâ€™s easy to get impatient at rests, and leave them before youâ€™ve milked them for all theyâ€™re worth. Yip likes to decide how long she needs to be at that rest beforehand, and then have her belayer set a timer to hold her accountable. On big projects, set smaller linking goals : We all need smaller victories on the way to clipping the chains. Before giving redpoint attempts, Yip will make a goal of linking from the ground to the end of the crux. Then sheâ€™ll try to link from the beginning of the crux to the chains. These overlapping links help mentally, too. She will make more mini-goals the longer term the project is.

author: NewsBreak
title: Blizzard or Near-Blizzard Conditions Possible Across Parts of Kansas, Missouri, and Illinois
text:
3 hours ago Heavy Snow, Ice, and Wind May Spread Into Indiana & Kentucky 01/02/25 4:07pm EST
12Z EURO 01/02/25 for 0/05/2542pm EST Photo by Tropical Tidbits Good afternoon everyone. We continue to watch the pieces of the puzzle moving into place in order to give ourselves our first true powerful winter storm system of the season.
This looks to be a big one, and not for the "typical" spots such as the Northeast & New England. Our first major storm for the season, looks ot impact the Midwest, Central, Gulf, and Mid-Atlantic states between this weekend and Monday from west to east.
Our first concern will be across parts of Kansas, Nebraska, Missouri, and Illinois as low pressure gets going and is energized by energy from the Gulf of Mexico. Very cold air rushing in behind it, plus cold low pressure keeping everything from progressing to the northeast, will help create a very long shield of frozen precipitation.
Where the air is cold enough, we'll see all snow and alot of it. By the time all is said and done, and we see where the heaviest snow band sets up, we could be dealing with 1-2ft of snow; plus winds in excess of 45-50mph in spots. This in turn, could also set the parameters for blizzard warnings in the final phase of dealing out watches and warnings across the region.
Another major hazard will be the freezing rain and sleet involved where overunning of warm air takes place, but stubborn cold air remains locked at the surface. Heavy freezing rain and sleet may occur as onset precipitation across parts of Kansas and Missouri before changing over to all snow, but we could also see a more prolonged period of icing across parts of east/central Missouri, lower Illinois, and lower Indiana.
This will also change to all snow, then eventually spread into Kenutcky, then Virginia and into Maryland and Delaware. We could also see some light to moderate snow in southern Pennsylvania and New Jersey; as well as some light snow and flurries possible across New York City and Long Island on Monday.
The final phase of this is the warm quadrant of our system, where severe weather is likely across parts of Texas, Louisiana, Arkansas, Mississippi, and Alabama. Look for a defined, fast-moving line to form Sunday afternoon, then race across the south and eventually into Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina.
Back in Texas, Arkansas, and the Gulf States, look for powerful thunderstorms capable of damaging winds in excess of 60mph, large hail, frequent lightning, torrential rain, and an elevated risk of tornadoes. Be prepared to take action in order to save property and/or life.
National Weather Service - Winter Storm Warning Till Sunday Evening - Topeka, KS
Severe Weather Risk Blizzard Freezing Rain Winter Travel Hazards Weather Forecast Accuracy 57

author: Josh Evanoff
title: Colby Covington responds to â€˜complete scrubâ€™ Michael Chandler after prelim comment: â€œIâ€™m an all-time great!â€
text:
Colby Covington responds to â€˜complete scrubâ€™ Michael Chandler after prelim comment: â€œIâ€™m an all-time great!â€
Former UFC interim welterweight champion Colby Covington is unhappy with Michael Chandler.
â€˜Chaosâ€™ is fresh off his return to the octagon at UFC 296 earlier this month. For Colby Covington, the bout was his first in well over a year, and it didnâ€™t go well. Facing
Leon Edwards in the main event of the pay-per-view offering from Las Vegas, he was dominated. The sight of Covington losing was a delight to some, including Michael Chandler.
â€˜Ironâ€™ was in attendance at UFC 296, to watch Leon Edwards defeat Colby Covington. Following the bout, Michael Chandler publically mocked â€˜Chaosâ€™ in several interviews and on social media. He specifically mocked the former interim championâ€™s friendship with Donald Trump. Chandler stated that Covington took
â€œ1776 shots to the faceâ€ in front of the former President.
With the loss, Michael Chandler added that Colby Covington was likely prelim bound. Itâ€™s clear that the former interim welterweight champion doesnâ€™t agree with those remarks at all.
Earlier this week, Colby Covington decided to respond to the former Bellator champion. Speaking on the PBD Podcast, the welterweight contender slammed Michael Chandler. Despite the latter stating that Covington would be bound for the prelims following his performance, he believes his resume would prevent that.
RELATED:
CODY GARBRANDT REJECTS POTENTIAL DOMINICK CRUZ REMATCH: â€œWHAT ELSE AM I SUPPOSED TO DO WITH THE GUY?â€
Colby Covington slams Michael Chandler following UFC 296 prelims comments
â€œMichael Chandler, who?â€ Colby Covington stated on the
PBD Podcast earlier this week, responding to comments from the UFC lightweight contender. â€œThat guy was getting knocked out in Bellator, that guy is a complete scrub. Whatâ€™s his UFC record? Like 1-4? Weâ€™re talking about that? My win percentage in the UFC is like over 90%, itâ€™s just, Iâ€™m an all-time great in this division.â€
He continued, â€œIâ€™ve done things in this division that people arenâ€™t ever going to do. Iâ€™m the only fighter to ever go to the White House and hang out with the sitting President. Iâ€™m the only one to ever have the first family, front row, Iâ€™m the only one to ever have a President out there supporting him. Dapping me up before I walk in the octagon.â€
â€œHe can keep talking all he wants,â€ Colby Covington concluded, referring to Michael Chandler. â€œBut, thereâ€™s no substance. Just another guy who is all talk, no walk.â€
Colby Covingtonâ€™s comments about Michael Chandler are just some of the few scathing remarks that heâ€™s made since his UFC 296 defeat. In the aftermath of the loss, he continued to mock Leon Edwardsâ€™ deceased father. Before their bout earlier this month, Covington stated that the father of â€˜Rockyâ€™ was in hell.
Following the loss, Covington also called to face Stephen Thompson. â€˜Wonderboyâ€™ too returned at UFC 296, suffering a submission loss to Shavkat Rakhmonov. However, in recent days, the former interim welterweight champion
has instead called out Ian Garry. As of now, â€˜The Futureâ€™ is slated to face Geoff Neal at UFC 298 in February.
What do you make of these comments from Colby Covington? Do you agree with â€˜Chaosâ€™? Or do you believe that Michael Chandler was correct about the welterweightâ€™s future?

author: MarÃ­a Albert
title: Una dermatÃ³loga enumera las cinco cosas que jamÃ¡s se harÃ­a en la piel: Â«Se ha encargado de castigarmeÂ»
text:
Una dermatÃ³loga enumera las cinco cosas que jamÃ¡s se harÃ­a en la piel: Â«Se ha encargado de castigarmeÂ»
La doctora Anna Puigdollers ha advertido sobre los errores que mÃ¡s cometemos a la hora de realizarnos nuestro 'skincare' diario
Una dermatÃ³loga explica cÃ³mo hacer una limpieza facial de forma correcta en menos de un minuto: Â«Fortalece la barrera cutÃ¡neaÂ»
Preguntan a jÃ³venes de EspaÃ±a cuÃ¡l es la carrera universitaria con mÃ¡s infieles: Â«Salen mucho de fiestaÂ»
Cada vez somos mÃ¡s conscientes de la importancia que puede tener para nuestra salud el cuidado de la piel o, como muchos lo llaman ahora, un buen 'skincare'. En los Ãºltimos aÃ±os, muchas personas se han sumado a esta oleada de productos â”€cremas hidratantes, sÃ©rums, limpiadores o tÃ³nicosâ”€ y tratamientos â”€lÃ¡seres, peelings, radiofrecuencia...â”€ que no han dejado de proliferar en las redes sociales con la intenciÃ³n de tener un rostro perfecto, sin imperfecciones y con aspecto casi de porcelana.
Sin embargo, mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de las recomendaciones que encontremos en internet, lo cierto es que lo mejor es seguir siempre los consejos de un especialista en la materia para lograr la mejor versiÃ³n de nuestra piel. Debemos tener en cuenta, ademÃ¡s, que no sÃ³lo son importantes los productos que empleemos, sino tambiÃ©n evitar los errores mÃ¡s habituales que cometemos y que los dermatÃ³logos pueden ayudarnos a prevenir.
Sobre esto Ãºltimo ha dado ahora mÃ¡s claves la doctora Anna Puigdollers, especialista en el tratamiento de la piel y con consulta en Barcelona. En uno de sus Ãºltimos vÃ­deos publicado en su cuenta de TikTok ha querido advertir a sus seguidores sobre las cinco cosas que jamÃ¡s harÃ­a para cuidar su piel como dermatÃ³loga y que se suelen hacer de vez en cuando.
Reventarse granos
En primer lugar, esta mÃ©dico especializada ha advertido sobre la importancia de Â«no reventarse granosÂ» para mantener nuestro rostro sano: Â«Cuando nos petamos granitos, estamos produciendo una herida en nuestra piel que es una autÃ©ntica puerta de entrada para que entren bacterias y sobreinfecten el grano, retrasando muchÃ­simo su curaciÃ³nÂ», ha explicado Puigdollers, seÃ±alando que Â«la porquerÃ­a puede hacer que se inflame mÃ¡s nuestra piel y que salgan mÃ¡s granitosÂ».
Realizarse procedimientos estÃ©ticos con personas no cualificadas
Como segunda recomendaciÃ³n, esta dermatÃ³loga ha solicitado que se eviten Â«procedimientos estÃ©ticos realizados por una persona que no estÃ© cualificadaÂ», incluyendo lÃ¡seres, peelings e infiltraciones de cualquier tipo de material. Â«Tampoco recomiendo y tampoco me lo harÃ­a yo si fuera por un profesional cualificado para hacer dicho procedimiento, pero no para tratar las complicaciones posiblesÂ», ha reconocido.
Seguir las recomendaciones de 'skincare' que ves en redes sociales
TambiÃ©n ha advertido sobre la importancia de no basar la rutina de 'skincare' en las recomendaciones de personas que no son dermatÃ³logas, como los 'skinfluencers' de redes sociales. Â«Toda su fuente de ingresos se basa en lo que les paga la cosmÃ©tica para que digan lo que quieren que digan. AdemÃ¡s, muchas veces tienen ya una piel espectacular, pero por genÃ©tica, no gracias a la crema que estÃ¡n vendiendoÂ», ha comentado. En su lugar, ha aconsejado acudir al dermatÃ³logo para seguir el procedimiento adecuado para nuestra piel.
Las limpiezas de cutis sin tratamientos previos
La doctora Anna Puigdollers tambiÃ©n ha advertido sobre los peligros de realizarse una limpieza de cutis si no se aplica un tratamiento que regule la glÃ¡ndula sebÃ¡cea, pues lo considera Â«contraproducenteÂ». Por su parte, ha explicado que tampoco se habrÃ­auna limpieza de cutis Â«si antes no me han abierto el poro, generalmente con vapor de agua calienteÂ»: Â«Es equivalente a estar reventÃ¡ndome granos y pueden aparecer las mismas complicaciones, desde marcas, manchas, hasta cicatrices e incluso queloidesÂ», ha alertado.
Irse a dormir con maquillaje y crema solar puesta
Por Ãºltimo, la dermatÃ³loga ha explicado que jamÃ¡s se irÃ­a a dormir con maquillaje o con crema solar puesta, pues Â«obstruye poros y puede hacer que salgan granos si lo hacÃ©isÂ». Cometer este error tambiÃ©n puede ser irritante para nuestra piel, ademÃ¡s de que los restos que quedan Â«son oxidantesÂ»: Â«Nos hace envejecer y pueden interrumpir el proceso de reparaciÃ³n que se produce por la noche en la pielÂ».
[@dra.annapuigdollers]5 cosas que no harÃ­a jamÃ¡s como dermatÃ³logaâ€¦ Aunque acabo confesando algunaâ€¦ ðŸ˜Œ Â¡Nadie es perfecto![#consejosdedermatÃ³loga][#dermatips][#dermatologist][#dermatology][#dernatologia][#consejossaludables][#creatorsearchinsights][â™¬ original sound - Anna Puigdollers]
Puigdollers tambiÃ©n ha seÃ±alado que esto no significa que no lo haya hecho nunca y que, aunque Â«una vez al aÃ±o no hace daÃ±oÂ», sÃ­ ha notado que esto puede provocarle problemas en el rostro: Â«Cuando me ha pasado, pues mi piel se ha encargado de castigarme con un buen brote de rosÃ¡cea y con tres granos nuevos al dÃ­a siguienteÂ», ha concluido.
Esta funcionalidad es sÃ³lo para suscriptores

author: Erika Wurst
title: Video: Man shot into the air prior to Tucson police shooting
text:
Newly released video shows the chaos Tucson police found in October during a deadly confrontation with a man firing a gun outside a home on the cityâ€™s south side.
Matthew Arthur Salinas, 43, is seen on video shooting a revolver into the air multiple times about 9:30 p.m. Oct. 26, before and as police officers arrive at the scene near West Bilby Road and South Sixth Avenue.
The Pima Regional Critical Incident Task Force (PRCIT) released the video and provided more details about the events that preceded the shooting , but said the case remains under investigation.
A 911 caller told a dispatcher that a neighbor was in her house looking for help.
 A 1960s Tucson home will soon be surrounded by new housing development Embattled U.S. 42 New Year's Eve events in Tucson to help you ring in 2024 Meet the Tucson man who saved Barbie 'We New Gunfire can be heard during portions of the 911 call.
Police body cam video shows officers nearby.
Officer Joshua Camacho, who has been with TPD for eight years, fires at Salinas from his department-issued rifle after another gunshot can be heard, the video shows.
Once law enforcement cleared the area they began rendering life-saving aid to Salinas. He was eventually declared dead at the scene.
â€œConclusions about whether the officerâ€™s actions were consistent with agency policy and the law will not be made until all the facts are known and the investigation is complete,â€ PRCIT said as part of the video. The team made up of law enforcement agencies across Pima County reviews police-involved shootings. The lead agencies in this particular review are the Pima County Sheriffâ€™s Department and the Oro Valley Police Department.
The Tucson Police Department is conducting a separate investigation to ensure department policies were followed.
Once PRCIT finishes its investigation it will present its findings to the Pima County Attorneyâ€™s Office for review, which is standard procedure.
Get your morning recap of today's local news and read the full stories here: tucne.ws/morning

author: Joseph BOYLE
title: Activist: â€˜Terribleâ€™ AI has given tech an existential headache | The Star
text:
LISBON: Technology firms are ceaselessly promoting new AI products, but climate activist Sage Lenier says AI is useless, unsustainable and has given the industry an existential problem.
"AI has no benefit to society," she told AFP on the sidelines of the Web Summit tech conference in Lisbon.
The CEOs who have become enraptured by a "useless" product class have smashed the idea of tech as an essential utility.
"And now they have an existential problem," she said.
Lenier first garnered attention as a 19-year-old student in 2018 when she founded and led a course at the University of California, Berkeley, titled "Solutions for a Sustainable & Just Future".
She has said students like her were sick of the kind of climate education that offered no hope â€“ she wanted to focus on the solutions not just the problems.
Hundreds joined the course at Berkeley over the years and eventually hundreds more online, and Lenier has since built a nonprofit around it and now hopes to launch a documentary series.
The California native, who now lives in New York, said she was largely positive about tech.
But her climate focus makes her an outsider at the Web Summit â€“ "I'll keep coming if they want me to shout at them," she said.
Last year, she told the crowd: "Some of you could be considered directly responsible for architecting the ecological crisis."
She implored tech bosses to embrace the circular economy, which relies on reusing and recycling rather than creating products that end up being junked.
But one year on, Microsoft, Google and others have unleashed an endless stream of energy-gobbling AI products.
They have rushed to reopen nuclear plants, pledged to build many more data centres â€“ and crashed through their climate targets.
â€˜Waste of emissionsâ€™
Yet AI, Lenier said, "has a million negatives".
"It is terrible for the planet. It's terrible for every community that you're running data centres in. And it's useless. I think it's just a waste of emissions," she said.
She points out that it was not always this way in the tech sector.
"It was the only industry, at least in America, where for years and years they tried to portray themselves as clean, green and pro-future," she said.
"Bill Gates has written multiple books on climate change."
The CEOs really want the image, and succeeded in dodging the kind of scrutiny put on the fashion and automotive industries.
"Then the moment they got an opportunity, with AI, to increase shareholder returns... every single one of them slammed the red button," she said.
â€˜So bad so fastâ€™
Although Lenier came to prominence by focusing attention on the solutions to the climate crisis, she sees a bleak future coming within a generation.
"(Expletive) is going to get so bad so fast. The food chain is going to break. We will see mass malnourishment if not mass starvation," she said.
The power grid, too, will break down.
Against this background, products like cars and new clothes are superfluous.
"You can't have cars in the long term. It doesn't matter if they're electric or not. They're unsustainable," she said.
"We can't be producing 80 billion garments of clothing a year in a low carbon future."
A year ago, she said she might have argued that tech was something different.
"It's a piece of our infrastructure, we built our societies around it," she said.
But with AI, "they've given themselves their own little fast fashion". â€“ AFP
